image.altText: Burnie woodchip pile supplied by Nearmap, taken on Feb 4 2024

props.synopsis: The woodchip pile has been in place for decades, and the idea of shifting it may have never crossed the mind of locals.

title.children: The 'Pyramids of Burnie' are a local icon, but some people think they should be shifted

image.altText: A large group of protesters carry banners and flags and shout chants.

props.synopsis: Pro-Palestine groups have rallied in Sydney, Melbourne and Adelaide on the eve of the first anniversary of the October 7 attack.

title.children: Thousands gather at pro-Palestine marches around the country

image.altText: Women in blue suits dance on documents with red signs

props.synopsis: The female artist behind the "women only" lounge at the centre of a discrimination complaint from a man who was refused entry says the space at Hobart's Mona will close.

title.children: 'No men allowed' ladies lounge to close as artist declares Mona artwork has 'run its course'

image.altText: Woman stands in poultry shed holding rooster

props.synopsis: The dumping of poultry on roadsides in Tasmania is such an issue some hotspots are known as "chook" or "rooster corners". It's prompted amnesty and rehoming days where hundreds of birds are surrendered and adopted into new homes.Â

title.children: Poultry abandoned at 'chook and rooster corners' on Tassie roadsides amid cost-of-living crunch

image.altText: A guy in a suit and tie sits in a room during an interview.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Labor party has endured four straight state election losses, surfacing from the latest with a new leader. Can Dean Winter turn that around?

title.children: Dean Winter has picked a lane â can he ride it to the next election?

image.altText: new beirut smoke

props.synopsis: Five Israeli strikes hit south Beirut and its outskirts on Saturday evening with four of them "very violent", according to official Lebanese media.

title.children: Five Israeli strikes hit south Beirut, four of them 'very violent', Lebanese media says

image.altText: Trumpie

props.synopsis: Donald Trump returns to Pennsylvania, where he was nearly assassinated in July, holding a rally with heightened security and guest Elon Musk.Â

title.children: 'We've bled together': Trump returns to site of Pennsylvania assassination attempt with Elon Musk

image.altText: A child sits next to a sandy crater

props.synopsis: With the first anniversary of the October 7 attacks on Israel looming, we ask a wide range of experts in the Middle East how the current crisis ends.

title.children: 'A genuine turning point in the Middle East': A year after the October 7 attacks, everything has changed

image.altText: A man holds a bunch of bridles.

props.synopsis: An independent stewards panel charges leading Tasmanian harness trainer Ben Yole, his brother and two harness drivers under the Australian Harness Racing Rules.

title.children: Did you miss? ð£ Long-awaited racing stewards report charges leading horse trainer Ben Yole and others

image.altText: The top of a Royal Hobart Hospital building with out of focus tree foliage in the foreground

props.synopsis: As Tasmania's health system continues to face critical staffing issues, the government has ramped up its reliance on locums â who are paid more, but have fewer workplace entitlements.

title.children: Locums help to 'fill gaps' in the health system. Tasmania's spend on them tripled in three years

image.altText: Jasmine Fleming celebrates a Hawks AFLW goal against Dockers.

props.synopsis: Hawthorn defender Mackenzie Eardley is sent to hospital during the Hawks' nine-point win over Fremantle, while Essendon earns a hard-fought victory over Gold Coast, and Geelong pips the Sydney Swans.

title.children: Injury-hit Hawks claim brave victory as Bombers, Cats chalk up wins

image.altText: Close up of some table salt on the palm of someone's hand.

props.synopsis: Salt is one of the most versatile resources in the world, and now that Australia's biggest solar salt farm is operational, it is expected to produce millions more tonnes each year.

title.children: Why does the world need so much salt? The answer is in almost everything you touch

image.altText: A road winds beside green paddocks.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's largest farm is back on the market and it is expected to fetch offers of more than $100 million.

title.children: 'Iconic' Rushy Lagoon â Tasmania's largest farm â goes on the market with interest for wind farm potential

image.altText: Fatima Payman quits Labor

props.synopsis: WA senator Fatima Payman, who resigned from Labor to sit as an independent, is set to announce the formation of a new political party targeting progressive voters in every state and territory.

title.children: Former Labor senator Fatima Payman to announce new political party

image.altText: A young Aboriginal child with traditional art painted on their body.

props.synopsis: Young leaders have been called upon to "keep our fire burning" as one of the country's largest Aboriginal land councils marks 50 years of fierce advocacy for land rights.

title.children: 'The young generation will carry on the dances and the stories': Central Land Council celebrates 50 years

image.altText: A sinking ship.

props.synopsis: New Zealand says it has rescued all 75 crew and passengers from a wrecked navy vessel that ran aground and sank off Samoa while conducting a reef survey.Â

title.children: New Zealand navy ship runs aground and sinks off Samoa

image.altText: A sign saying 'Ashley Youth Detention Centre' outside some fencing.

props.synopsis: A plan to build five facilities with a "therapeutic" approach to youth detention â to fill the gap when Tasmania's Ashley youth detention centre closes â appears to have been placed on the backburner, with the minister insisting it's not about cost.

title.children: Ashley youth detention replacement plan shelved as government looks to fund existing services

image.altText: A close up of a bald man wearing a striped shirt standing in his garage.

props.synopsis: Soaring power bills and plunging incentives for excess solar power are pushing more Australian households into installing home energy storage. Yet these batteries are still very expensive and don't stack up for many.

title.children: 'There's a supply glut': The problem with solar feed-in tariffs

image.altText: An elderly man wearing a military hat and war medals.

props.synopsis: Glenn Dobie served Australia during World War II, but his friends and family later discovered he never received the recognition he was entitled to.

title.children: World War II veteran receives missing service medals nearly 80 years later

image.altText: Eliesa Katoa is tackled

props.synopsis: Melbourne Storm and three-time defending premiers Penrith Panthers lock horns in the NRL grand final at Sydney's Stadium Australia. Follow live.

title.children: Panthers and Storm clash in epic NRL grand final

image.altText: Departure/arrival signs at the entrance to Melbourne Airport.

props.synopsis: Assistant Minister for Immigration Matt Thistlethwaite has offered a scathing assessment of Australia's approach to immigration. A lot rides on the government's efforts to re-establish bipartisanship, writes Gareth Hutchens. Â

title.children: Immigration has provided 'marginal economic benefit', says the assistant minister. A lot rides on what happens next

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson with his eyebrows raised and mouth open. The Hard Quiz logo is in the top right corner

props.synopsis: Oh, you won a trivia night once? Cute. Now itâs time to play â¦ HARD!Â

title.children: You think you know it all? Don't be shy now. Let's play â¦ HARD!

image.altText: A composite of Kamala Harris and Cate Blanchet.

props.synopsis: Across Australia, households on six-figure incomes are struggling to pay the rent or mortgages â let alone afford little luxuries. Others are delaying retirement or working extra jobs to pay the bills.

title.children: High earners like Kamala Harris and Cate Blanchett call themselves middle class, but are they?

image.altText: Wide show of Ratcliffe coal plant, with fence and coal yard in the foreground and plant and power lines in the background

props.synopsis: More than 150 years after pioneering the technology, the UK has shut its last coal-fired power station. Experts say it's a seminal moment for the energy transition.

title.children: The birthplace of the industrial revolution is done with coal. What does that tell the rest of the world?

image.altText: An elderly man in a high-vis work shirt leaning on timber frame of his verandah.

props.synopsis: Through mining booms and busts, the Kalgoorlie Nickel Smelter in Western Australia has operated continuously since 1973. But workers are now being stood down as BHP prepares to place its Nickel West division on care and maintenance.Â

title.children: Graeme reluctantly hangs up his high-vis as nickel smelter marks 'end of an era'

image.altText: A five year old girl being hugged passionately by her mother

props.synopsis: On a quiet October day in 1972, Victoria Police faced the unthinkable when six students and a teacher were kidnapped from a country school. Now one of the survivors is sharing her story.

title.children: 'Crime of the century' survivor breaks silence 52 years after Faraday school kidnapping

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: An adult and a child are dead after a buggy carrying four people rolled at a private property at Tubbut, in Victoria's east.

title.children: Two people killed in buggy rollover in Victoria's east

image.altText: backyard fence on surburban property

props.synopsis: While generally it is up to neighbours to split the cost of the build, repair, or replacement of a shared fence, it's not always as simple as splitting it down the middle.

title.children: 'It doesn't have to be split equally': Who pays when building or repairing a shared fence?

image.altText: Vineyards damaged by frost.

props.synopsis: As crop growers across the country's south-east come to grips with the fallout from last month's unseasonally freezing overnight temperatures, there are calls for the event to be treated as a natural disaster in order to trigger urgent government assistance.

title.children: 'Like a blowtorch': From above, the frost impact on vineyards is obvious

image.altText: GettyImages-2176963816

props.synopsis: The Wallaroos move closer to a WXV2 tournament title with a gutsy win over South Africa in Cape Town.

title.children: 'That's Australian heart right there': Wallaroos hold off a fast finishing South Africa in Cape Town

image.altText: Beth Mooney plays a shot while batting against Sri Lanka

props.synopsis: Pace star Megan Schutt equals a record and opener Beth Mooney produces a steadying knock as Australia open their T20 World Cup title defence with a six-wicket win over Sri Lanka.

title.children: Mooney to the rescue as Australia beats Sri Lanka in T20 World Cup opener

image.altText: A young woman wearing a black t-shirt emblazoned with a sunflower sits at a small outside table.

props.synopsis: The 28-year-old is training to become a paramedic in the hope she can "make a difference" to anyone suffering the way her loved ones did.

title.children: After losing 10 people to suicide, Sofia's joining the front lines of Australia's mental health battle

image.altText: Scott Sorensen smiling at a Panthers' training session before 2024 NRL grand final.

props.synopsis: Penrith utility forward Scott Sorensen is given the green light to play on Sunday night, as the Melbourne Storm show confidence in the least experienced player in 30 years to feature in a season decider.

title.children: Panthers receive major boost ahead of NRL grand final, Storm back rookie to rise to the occasion

image.altText: An elderly man in a suit poses for a photo in front of a photo wall emblazoned with the words Megalopolis: A Fable.

props.synopsis: Clive Hamilton's 2003 book Growth Fetish made waves in Australia. Turns out it made its way to Hollywood, too.

title.children: Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopolis is a fight for humanityâs future. He was inspired by an Australian
